Question: Flush medians can be used when:
What is the best way to check for hazards before reversing your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Relying only on the outside mirrors
Turning to look over your shoulders
Relying only on the inside mirrors
Walking around the vehicle before reversing

Question: Before any modification is carried out on your vehicle, you should:

Answers.Answer: remove the registration plates from your vehicle
check with an authorised vehicle inspection centre
check that your warrant of fitness is current to within 1 month
record the modification on your vehicle ownership papers

Question: You must NOT open the door of your motor vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: you are parked within 10 metres of a bus stop
you are likely to scratch the paint of your vehicle
the car radio in your vehicle is playing loud music
you are likely to hurt any person

Question: When coming to a pedestrian crossing without a raised traffic island, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians on your side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on any part of the crossing
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all oncoming traffic

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What is the speed limit for vehicles passing a school bus that has stopped to let children on or off?
When should you use the fog lights on your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: When you are in a hurry during the day
When you are coming up to an airport at night
When there is no fog but you want other drivers to see you
When you cannot see because of foggy conditions

Question: What should you do when you come up to a one-lane bridge?

Answers.Answer: Sound your vehicle horn and drive slowly over the bridge
Turn your vehicle headlights on and drive quickly over the bridge
Slow down and check for any oncoming vehicles before driving on
Drive on and make sure any oncoming vehicles reverse off the bridge

Question: You are driving past a line of parked cars. You notice a ball bouncing out into the road ahead. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving at the same speed
Keep driving at the same speed and flash the vehicle’s headlights
Slow down and be prepared to stop for children
Slow down and move to the right-hand side of the road

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When passing a bus displaying a School sign, that has stopped to let children on or off, what should your speed be?
When coming to a pedestrian crossing with a raised traffic island in the middle, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians who are on your half of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Remain stopped until the pedestrian has reached the other side of the road
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all on coming traffic

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Who is responsible for making a child under 14 years use a seat belt or a safety seat in a vehicle?
What must you do at an intersection controlled by a Stop sign?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop
Stop only if you can do so safely
Continue driving unless you can see an oncoming vehicle

Question: If you have a learner licence you can carry passengers if your supervisor is in the back seat.
What does a white diamond painted on the road mean?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Which parts of the car must be in good condition to prevent too much noise and gases entering the car?

Answers.Answer: Good mud guards and mud flaps
A good silencer and exhaust system

Question: What does a blue reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road

Question: What should you do when driving in foggy weather?

Answers.Answer: Stay close to the vehicle ahead of you
Turn your vehicle headlights onto dip
Use the centre line as a guide
Turn your vehicle park lights on

Question: You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.
You can stop or park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if someone stays with the vehicle who can move it.
How close can you park your vehicle to the approach side of a pedestrian crossing where no broken yellow lines have been marked?
What is the maximum distance a load may extend in front of a car?

Answers.Answer: 2 metres from the front edge of the front seat
3 metres from the front edge of the front seat
4 metres from the front edge of the front seat
5 metres from the front edge of the front seat

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive faster than 50km/h unless the road is clear
There is a rest area 50 metres ahead

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does it mean if yellow traffic signals are flashing?

Answers.Answer: That a crash has just happened
The traffic signals are not working, apply the give way rules
Vehicles may only proceed straight ahead and not turn
Emergency vehicles are about to come through

Question: When coming up to a roundabout you must give way to all vehicles that will cross your path from your left.
What should you do if the vehicle behind you wishes to pass?

Answers.Answer: Move to the centre so that they cannot pass
Speed up so that they will not need to pass
Move as far to the left side of the road as is safe
